qas.question: What is the term for a software product abandoned by its owners?
What device allows backing up SNES games?
What is the term for homemade software?
What did owners of the respective game consider emulators?
What status did discontinued image files have?
What did Nintendo do under abandonware status via the Retrode?

plausible_answers.text: the distribution of SNES ROM image files

qas.question: What were emulation supporters against regarding files?
What other system did supporters of SNES emulation also take the same stance with?

context: Nintendo of America took the same stance against <b7_0>the distribution of SNES ROM image files<b7_0/> and the use of emulators as it did with <b8_0>the NES<b8_0/>, insisting that they represented <a0_0><b4_0>flagrant software piracy<b4_0/><a0_0/>. Proponents of SNES emulation cite discontinued production of the SNES constituting <a1_0><b5_0>abandonware<a1_0/> status<b5_0/>, the right of the owner of the respective game to <b6_0>make a personal backup<b6_0/> via devices such as the <a2_0>Retrode<a2_0/>, space shifting for private use, the desire to develop <a3_0>homebrew<a3_0/> games for the system, the frailty of SNES ROM cartridges and consoles, and the lack of certain foreign imports.
